Information :

Steak is a high-quality cut of meat that comes from various parts of beef, including the loin, rib, and sirloin. It is a popular dish worldwide and is typically cooked by grilling, broiling, or pan-frying. Different types of steak have different levels of tenderness, flavor, and fat content. For example, filet mignon is a tender, lean cut with a mild flavor, while ribeye has a higher fat content and a more robust flavor. When selecting a steak, look for marbling, which refers to the flecks of fat within the muscle fibers. More marbling typically indicates a more tender and flavorful steak. Additionally, it's important to consider the grade of the steak, which is based on the amount of marbling, tenderness, and overall quality. Some popular cooking methods for steak include grilling, which provides a smoky flavor and charred crust, broiling, which cooks the steak quickly and evenly, and pan-frying, which allows for precise control over the temperature and level of doneness. Steak can be served with a variety of sides, such as roasted vegetables, mashed potatoes, or a simple salad. It's also often served with a sauce or seasoning, such as a classic béarnaise sauce, garlic butter, or a sprinkle of sea salt and cracked black pepper.

Ingredients :

  • 2 lbs New York Strip Steaks (2 steaks), or Ribeye or Top Sirloin Steaks (1 lb each steak, 1 1/4” thick)
  • 1/2 Tbsp vegetable oil, or any high heat cooking oil like canola or extra light olive oil
  • 1 1/2 tsp sea salt
  • 1 tsp black pepper, freshly ground
  • 2 Tbsp unsalted butter
  • 2 cloves garlic, peeled and quartered
  • 1 sprig fresh rosemary

Instructions :

  • Thoroughly pat steak dry with paper towels. Just before cooking, generously season with 1 1/2 tsp salt and 1 tsp black pepper
  • Heat the cast iron pan until hot then add 1/2 Tbsp oil over medium-high heat, swirling to coat. Once the oil is very hot, add steaks to the skillet. Sear the steaks on the first side for 4 minutes until a brown crust has formed then flip and cook another 3-4 minutes. Using tongs, turn the steak on its sides to render the white fat and sear the edges (1-minute per edge).
  • Reduce heat to medium and immediately add 2 Tbsp butter, quartered garlic cloves and rosemary to the pan. Spoon the butter sauce over the steak, tilting the pan to get butter on your spoon. Continue spooning the sauce over the steak for a minute or until the steak is about 5-10 degrees from your desired doneness (the temperature will continue to rise another 5-10 degrees while steaks rest).
  • Transfer steak to a cutting board, loosely cover and rest 10 minutes before slicing into 1/2" strips to serve. Spoon extra butter sauce over sliced steak to serve.
